meanings.definition: Emit a long, deep audible breath expressing sadness, relief, tiredness, or similar emotion.
meanings.sent1: She sighs heavily after a long day at work.
meanings.sent2: He often sighs when he feels sad.
meanings.sent3: The cat sighs dramatically when it sees the empty food bowl.
meanings.sent4: The wind sighs through the trees on a quiet night.
meanings.sent5: The old man sighs with contentment as he watches the sunset.

meanings.sent1: The room was filled with the soft sighs of tired students.
meanings.sent2: I heard a gentle sigh coming from the next room.
meanings.sent3: The sighs of the wind outside lulled me to sleep.
meanings.sent4: The sighs of the violin in the music piece were hauntingly beautiful.
meanings.sent5: The collective sighs of the audience filled the theater after the emotional performance.
